newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent jumps higher on Iraq, nervous markets.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent jumps higher on Iraq, nervous markets.

text.p: IPE Brent crude oil futures jumped sharply higher in nervous trading on Tuesday after Iraq said it had fired three missiles at U.S. aircraft, traders said.

IPE Brent stood 21 cents up at $22.82 at 1810 GMT, a jump of almost 20 cents from a few minutes earlier, following a day of very choppy trading. The contract earlier broke upwards through $22.85 five-month highs before settling back sharply.
"People are nervous at the moment," one IPE dealer said. "A lot of people were short and a headline like this will cause a sharp jump".
